user.bio: “La perfection est atteinte, non pas lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à ajouter, mais lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à retirer.”

commit.title: [core] [api] Support OCaml 4.08
commit.message:
[core] [api] Support OCaml 4.08

This is an updated version of #9635 , proving a warning-free build in
OCaml 4.08.

The changes are large, and annoying:

- modules `Int` and `Option` have been renamed to `CInt` and `COption`
  due to conflicts with upstream.

- the `Pervasives` module has been deprecated in favor of `Stdlib`, we
  have opted for introducing a few wrapping functions in `Util` and
  just unqualified the rest of occurrences. We avoid the shims as in
  the previous attempt.

- a few bugs regarding partial application have been fixed.

- some formatting functions have been deprecated, but previous
  versions don't include a replacement, thus the warning has been
  disabled.

We may clean up things a bit more, in particular w.r.t. modules once
we can move to OCaml 4.07 as the minimum required version.

On the good side, OCaml 4.08.0 does provide a few interesting
functionalities, including nice new warnings useful for devs.

user.name: Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias
user.bio: “La perfection est atteinte, non pas lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à ajouter, mais lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à retirer.”

commit.title: [core] [api] Support OCaml 4.08
commit.message:
[core] [api] Support OCaml 4.08

This is an updated version of #9635 , proving a warning-free build in
OCaml 4.08.

The changes are large, and annoying:

- modules `Int` and `Option` have been renamed to `CInt` and `COption`
  due to conflicts with upstream.

- the `Pervasives` module has been deprecated in favor of `Stdlib`, we
  have opted for introducing a few wrapping functions in `Util` and
  just unqualified the rest of occurrences. We avoid the shims as in
  the previous attempt.

- a few bugs regarding partial application have been fixed.

- some formatting functions have been deprecated, but previous
  versions don't include a replacement, thus the warning has been
  disabled.

We may clean up things a bit more, in particular w.r.t. modules once
we can move to OCaml 4.07 as the minimum required version.

On the good side, OCaml 4.08.0 does provide a few interesting
functionalities, including nice new warnings useful for devs.

user.name: Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias
user.bio: “La perfection est atteinte, non pas lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à ajouter, mais lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à retirer.”

OCaml 4.08.

The changes are large, and annoying:

- modules `Int` and `Option` have been renamed to `CInt` and `COption`
  due to conflicts with upstream.

- the `Pervasives` module has been deprecated in favor of `Stdlib`, we
  have opted for introducing a few wrapping functions in `Util` and
  just unqualified the rest of occurrences. We avoid the shims as in
  the previous attempt.

- a few bugs regarding partial application have been fixed.

- some formatting functions have been deprecated, but previous
  versions don't include a replacement, thus the warning has been
  disabled.

We may clean up things a bit more, in particular w.r.t. modules once
we can move to OCaml 4.07 as the minimum required version.

On the good side, OCaml 4.08.0 does provide a few interesting
functionalities, including nice new warnings useful for devs.

user.name: Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias
user.bio: “La perfection est atteinte, non pas lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à ajouter, mais lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à retirer.”
